title: Oxford Bus Company staff raise funds for special school

title_detail.value: Oxford Bus Company staff raise funds for special school

summary: IT WAS their job to keep Oxford buses running on the roads, but they still made time to support worthy causes

summary_detail.value: IT WAS their job to keep Oxford buses running on the roads, but they still made time to support worthy causes

author: Andrew Ffrench
generated_summary: In 1985, employees at the Oxford Bus Company raised over £3,000 for charitable causes, including purchasing a computer for Mabel Prichard School for handicapped children and donating funds to the John Radcliffe Hospital’s special care baby unit and Park Hospital for children's holidays. The funds were raised through raffles, charity auctions, and a London to Brighton cycle race. Their efforts earned them a fifth-place ranking in a national fundraising contest, securing an additional £250 for charity. The company, now located on Watlington Road, continues to play a vital role in Oxfordshire's public transport with a focus on electric vehicles.

title: Number of electric vehicle chargers in Dudley fell by a tenth last year

title_detail.value: Number of electric vehicle chargers in Dudley fell by a tenth last year

summary: The number of public electric vehicle chargers drivers had access to in Dudley fell by a tenth last year, new figures show.

summary_detail.value: The number of public electric vehicle chargers drivers had access to in Dudley fell by a tenth last year, new figures show.

author: Stourbridge News Staff
generated_summary: The number of public electric vehicle (EV) chargers in Dudley decreased by 10% over the past year, dropping from 198 to 179, according to Department for Transport figures. This decline raises concerns from the RAC about inconsistent charger availability across the UK, with some areas having significantly fewer chargers per capita. Nationally, the installation of EV chargers has increased by 47%, with 65,000 chargers in place by July, aligning with the government's target of 300,000 by 2030. Despite progress, disparities in charger distribution remain, particularly outside London, which holds nearly a third of the national total. The RAC emphasizes the need for prioritizing regions with poor charger access and highlights the importance of rapid chargers for EV users without home charging options. The Department for Transport is committed to accelerating the installation of charge-points nationwide to boost confidence in transitioning to zero-emission vehicles.

title: The next 12 Norwich streets to get electric car chargers

title_detail.value: The next 12 Norwich streets to get electric car chargers

summary: Work to install electric vehicle charging points on another dozen Norwich streets will begin next week.

summary_detail.value: Work to install electric vehicle charging points on another dozen Norwich streets will begin next week.

author: Dan Grimmer
generated_summary: Norfolk County Council is set to install electric vehicle chargers on 12 additional streets in Norwich as part of its 2021 strategy to promote electric vehicle use. Starting November 25, 22 new charging points will be installed by Blink Charging UK, continuing until February next year. This expansion follows the installation of 24 chargers across the city, with almost 200 vehicles charged since the first ones went live. The initiative aims to support a greener future by providing accessible public charging infrastructure, particularly for residents without private driveways. Streets slated for new chargers include Fishergate, St Mary's Plain, and Dolphin Grove. The council reports that 3,086 kWh of power has been used, saving over 2.6 million kg of CO2.

title: Norfolk firm launches new department to fulfil international orders

title_detail.value: Norfolk firm launches new department to fulfil international orders

summary: Prior Power Solutions, in Great Yarmouth, Norfolk, has launched a new welding and fabrication department to fulfil a growing number of…

summary_detail.value: Prior Power Solutions, in Great Yarmouth, Norfolk, has launched a new welding and fabrication department to fulfil a growing number of…

author: Adam Barker
generated_summary: Prior Power Solutions, a Great Yarmouth-based engine and equipment manufacturer, has launched a new welding and fabrication department to cater to a growing number of international orders. The department, located at Gapton Hall Industrial Estate, allows the company to offer in-house fabrication, ensuring quality control, reduced lead times, and cost-effectiveness for customers. Production Manager Chris Farman highlighted the completion of ten skid frames for the offshore industry, including two acoustic frames built to DNV 2.7-1 standards. The company, originally established as Prior Diesel Ltd in 1980 and part of the Suretank Group since 2015, has invested in staff training and infrastructure, resulting in fabrication work being secured from locations as far as Angola.

title: Changes driven by Musk biggest threat to China under Trump 2.0, adviser warns

title_detail.value: Changes driven by Musk biggest threat to China under Trump 2.0, adviser warns

summary: Greatest pressure to ‘come from changes within the US’, Zheng Yongnian says, urging China to expand opening up as a countermeasure.

summary_detail.value: Greatest pressure to ‘come from changes within the US’, Zheng Yongnian says, urging China to expand opening up as a countermeasure.

author: South China Morning Post
generated_summary: A leading Chinese political scientist, Zheng Yongnian, has warned that China's biggest challenge during a potential second term for Donald Trump as U.S. president could stem from government changes influenced by tech billionaire Elon Musk. Zheng, who is a policy adviser to Beijing, suggests that China should counter this by expanding unilateral opening-up measures, particularly towards the U.S., to gain leverage in the ongoing US-China rivalry. He predicts that while Trump’s return could cause significant short-term economic and trade disruptions through tariffs, it might not lead to increased geopolitical tensions. Zheng emphasizes the importance of being more open to maintain competitive advantage.

title: Treasure trove of vintage Mercedes cars found in rural barn in Essex

title_detail.value: Treasure trove of vintage Mercedes cars found in rural barn in Essex

summary: The 1921 Talbot Darracq and a 1952 Mercedes Benz 220 Type A convertible had been hidden away in Framlingham, Suffolk after the death of their owner.

summary_detail.value: The 1921 Talbot Darracq and a 1952 Mercedes Benz 220 Type A convertible had been hidden away in Framlingham, Suffolk after the death of their owner.

author: Robert Folker
generated_summary: A remarkable discovery of vintage cars occurred in Essex, where two classic vehicles, a 1921 Talbot Darracq and a 1952 Mercedes Benz 220 Type A convertible, were found in a barn after 40 years. These cars, preserved by their late owner, fetched higher-than-expected prices at auction, with the Mercedes selling for £37,000 and the Talbot for £10,500. The owner, a former British Army serviceman, had acquired these cars during his military service, and they had remained unused since the 1980s. The auction took place at Reeman Dansie Auctions in Colchester. This discovery follows a similar find in Wales, where a collection of iconic yet deteriorating cars, including Bentleys and Jaguars, was uncovered, estimated to be worth up to £1 million. These hidden treasures highlight the enduring appeal and value of classic automobiles.

title: New speed camera praised for highlighting city suburb's 'racer' problem

title_detail.value: New speed camera praised for highlighting city suburb's 'racer' problem

summary: The installation of a new speed awareness camera in Costessey is being hailed as a good way to crack down on speeders and "racers".

summary_detail.value: The installation of a new speed awareness camera in Costessey is being hailed as a good way to crack down on speeders and "racers".

author: Edward Dewulf-Peters
generated_summary: A new SAM2 speed awareness camera in Costessey is being praised for its effectiveness in addressing a speeding problem in the area. Residents on Townhouse Road have reported a decrease in speeding since the camera's installation, which displays vehicle speeds to warn drivers but does not issue fines. The camera, funded and installed with the help of Costessey councillors Jenny McCloskey and Ross Wheeldon, collects data that can be shared with police and local authorities to consider further measures, such as speed cameras or road humps. The camera will remain in its current location for four weeks before being moved to Norwich Road in December. This initiative is seen as a preliminary step in identifying and addressing dangerous speeding areas.

title: 'Accident waiting to happen' on A46 as sudden speed limit change slammed

title_detail.value: 'Accident waiting to happen' on A46 as sudden speed limit change slammed

summary: Coventry Live readers have been sharing their views on speed limits as the A46 from the M6, as after the Binley flyover, the speed limit suddenly drops from 70 to 50

summary_detail.value: Coventry Live readers have been sharing their views on speed limits as the A46 from the M6, as after the Binley flyover, the speed limit suddenly drops from 70 to 50

author: Coventry Live readers
generated_summary: Coventry residents are expressing concerns about a sudden speed limit drop on the A46 route from the M6, following the Binley flyover, where it changes from 70 mph to 50 mph. Local drivers claim this abrupt change is confusing and potentially dangerous, as newcomers often brake suddenly, fearing speed cameras, while regulars continue at higher speeds. Some residents suggest implementing average speed cameras to enforce the limit consistently. The speed reduction is attributed to a bend under the Toll Bar junction, which poses a risk of vehicle overturning, and the availability of parking spots for mobile speed cameras. Despite the concerns, many drivers acknowledge the importance of adhering to the speed limits for safety.

title: Missing man was found dead at Dorset beauty spot

title_detail.value: Missing man was found dead at Dorset beauty spot

summary: A man was found dead at a Dorset beauty spot after going missing, an inquest heard.

summary_detail.value: A man was found dead at a Dorset beauty spot after going missing, an inquest heard.

author: Jess Skelton
generated_summary: James Michael Whitney, a 48-year-old architect, was found dead near Old Harry Rocks in Dorset after going missing. He was last seen leaving work in Christchurch on September 12, and his car was later found in Swanage. Despite a search involving the HM Coastguard, a helicopter, and Dorset Search and Rescue, his body was discovered on September 13. A post-mortem revealed he died from multiple injuries due to a fall from a cliff, and the death was ruled a suicide by the Dorset Coroner’s Court. Whitney's disappearance was described as out of character by his wife and business partner.

title: Elon Musk Gets a Crash Course in How Trumpworld Works

title_detail.value: Elon Musk Gets a Crash Course in How Trumpworld Works

summary: The world’s richest person, not known for his humility, is still learning the cutthroat courtier politics of Donald Trump’s inner circle — and his ultimate influence remains an open question.

summary_detail.value: The world’s richest person, not known for his humility, is still learning the cutthroat courtier politics of Donald Trump’s inner circle — and his ultimate influence remains an open question.

author: Theodore Schleifer
generated_summary: Elon Musk, the world's richest person, is navigating the complex political landscape of Donald Trump's inner circle after aligning with the president-elect. Despite lacking the long-standing ties that many of Trump's aides have, Musk's immense wealth and influence, including his 200 million followers on X and the $200 million he spent to support Trump's election, have impressed Trump. Musk has been closely involved with Trump, attending meetings and events, such as a SpaceX launch in Texas. The tech billionaire's role in the administration is speculated to involve leading a Department of Government Efficiency alongside Vivek Ramaswamy. Observers in Washington and Silicon Valley are uncertain about how long the Musk-Trump relationship will last, noting it may depend on Musk's ability to navigate the cutthroat politics of Trumpworld.

title: Electric shock: carmakers battle strict UK electric car rules as big fines loom

title_detail.value: Electric shock: carmakers battle strict UK electric car rules as big fines loom

summary: As Ford announced cutting 800 UK jobs it said rules forcing companies to sell more EVs each year are ‘unworkable’

summary_detail.value: As Ford announced cutting 800 UK jobs it said rules forcing companies to sell more EVs each year are ‘unworkable’

author: Jasper Jolly
generated_summary: Carmakers, including Ford, are challenging the UK's zero-emission vehicle (ZEV) mandate, which requires an increasing percentage of electric vehicle (EV) sales yearly, with substantial fines for non-compliance. Ford, having previously supported stricter EV sales targets, now criticizes the policy as "unworkable" amidst slowing demand for fully electric cars, which is partly due to concerns over charging infrastructure and the cost of EVs. The mandate aims for 22% of new vehicle sales to be electric in 2024, rising to 28% by 2025, with a goal of 80% by 2030. The automotive industry is lobbying for more flexibility, citing job and investment risks, while facing opposition from charger companies and environmental groups who argue that relaxing the mandate could jeopardize climate goals. Despite loopholes reducing the effective target, some carmakers may struggle to meet the requirements and face fines. The UK government remains divided on whether to ease these rules, with ongoing debates about balancing industry needs with environmental commitments.

title: Jeff Bezos’ $500 million superyacht spotted sailing for the first time in a spectacle everyone was waiting for

title_detail.value: Jeff Bezos’ $500 million superyacht spotted sailing for the first time in a spectacle everyone was waiting for

summary: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos' $500 million superyacht spotted sailing in the Bay of Palma - Known as Koru, it's one of the world’s most prestigious superyachts

summary_detail.value: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos' $500 million superyacht spotted sailing in the Bay of Palma - Known as Koru, it's one of the world’s most prestigious superyachts

author: @NalinRawat
generated_summary: Jeff Bezos' $500 million superyacht, Koru, was recently spotted sailing in the Bay of Palma, Mallorca. This three-masted vessel, built by Oceanco in the Netherlands, is one of the world's most prestigious superyachts and was the second-largest of its kind when commissioned. The yacht's recent sighting marks its return to Mallorca after its maiden voyage two years ago. It remains unclear if Bezos or his girlfriend, Lauren Sanchez, were onboard during this trip, as the yacht might be undergoing routine equipment trials. The annual maintenance cost for Koru and its support vessel, Abeona, is approximately $35 million.

title: What Elon Musk Needs From China

title_detail.value: What Elon Musk Needs From China

summary: From electric cars to solar panels, Mr. Musk has built businesses in high-tech manufacturing sectors now targeted by Beijing for Chinese dominance.

summary_detail.value: From electric cars to solar panels, Mr. Musk has built businesses in high-tech manufacturing sectors now targeted by Beijing for Chinese dominance.

author: Keith Bradsher
generated_summary: Elon Musk's business ventures, particularly Tesla, have significant stakes in China, where half of Tesla's cars are produced and a major portion of sales occur. However, Musk faces challenges due to increasing local competition and regulatory restrictions on Tesla's self-driving technology. Despite these hurdles, Musk's strong ties with Chinese leaders, such as Premier Li Qiang, may position him as a key intermediary for conveying messages between China and President-elect Donald Trump, amid trade tensions. Musk's other ventures in solar energy and batteries also contend with robust Chinese competitors, although U.S.-China economic decoupling could offer some advantages by limiting Chinese automakers' access to the U.S. market.

title: Nissan warns of emergency as car brands scramble to meet electric car targets or risk 'irreversible impact'

title_detail.value: Nissan warns of emergency as car brands scramble to meet electric car targets or risk 'irreversible impact'

author: Felix Reeves
generated_summary: Nissan has issued a warning to the UK Government, urging a revision of the Zero Emission Vehicle (ZEV) mandate due to slower-than-expected electric vehicle (EV) sales. The Japanese automaker, which runs the largest car manufacturing plant in Sunderland, cautioned that failing to meet ambitious EV targets could lead to severe financial penalties, threaten thousands of jobs, and impact billions in investment. Current projections show EV sales reaching only 18.5% of the market this year, below the 22% target for 2024, with expectations increasing to 80% by 2030 and 100% by 2035. Nissan suggests changes to the ZEV mandate, such as increased flexibility in borrowing credits and a monitoring period to replace fines. The company emphasizes the need for urgent government action to prevent an "irreversible impact" on the UK automotive sector. Nissan remains committed to UK manufacturing, contributing over £2 billion annually to the economy and planning new EV production as part of its EV36Zero initiative.

title: BMW Introduces 2025 F 900 R and F 900 XR

title_detail.value: BMW Introduces 2025 F 900 R and F 900 XR

summary: BMW Introduces 2025 F 900 R and F 900 XR, featuring new technical and styling upgrades and significantly extended standard equipment.

summary_detail.value: BMW Introduces 2025 F 900 R and F 900 XR, featuring new technical and styling upgrades and significantly extended standard equipment.

author: Michael Gougis
generated_summary: BMW Motorrad USA has unveiled the updated 2025 F 900 R and F 900 XR motorcycles, featuring significant technical and visual enhancements. The new models include an extended range of standard equipment, such as fully adjustable upside-down forks, lighter wheels, and a weight reduction of 6.6 lbs. Both bikes are equipped with a 105 hp 895 cc two-cylinder engine meeting Euro 5+ standards, and they now come with "Dynamic" riding mode and Dynamic Traction Control (DTC) as standard for improved safety and handling. The F 900 R is designed for sporty riding, while the F 900 XR is suited for both winding roads and longer tours with luggage. Additional features include BMW Motorrad ABS Pro for safer braking in corners, Dynamic Brake Control, and a lighter battery. The F 900 XR also boasts Headlight Pro with adaptive headlight technology for enhanced nighttime visibility. New ergonomic adjustments offer a sportier riding position for the F 900 R and improved aerodynamics for the F 900 XR. The models also come with the Ultimate Care Break-In Service as standard, adding to the premium customer experience.
